revision.comment: BDD moved page [[Talk:Air Transport Command (World War II)]] to [[Talk:Air Transport Command]]: RM; see talk page
revision.text:
{{WikiProjectBannerShell |1= {{WPAVIATION|class=C|B-Class-1=n|B-Class-2=y|B-Class-3=y|B-Class-4=y|B-Class-5=y}} {{WPMILHIST|class=C | |B-Class-1=no |B-Class-2=yes |B-Class-3=yes |B-Class-4=yes |B-Class-5=yes |US-task-force=yes |Aviation-task-force=yes |WWII-task-force=yes }} {{WPUSA|class=C|USMIL=yes}} }} ==Comments== Article has had major revision and additions [[User:Bwmoll3|Bwmoll3]] ([[User talk:Bwmoll3|talk]]) 21:43, 8 April 2014 (UTC) ==Requested move==
:''The following discussion is an archived discussion of the proposal. '''Please do not modify it.''' Subsequent comments should be made in a new section on the talk page. No further edits should be made to this section. '' The result of the proposal was '''moved'''. --[[User:BDD|BDD]] ([[User talk:BDD|talk]]) 22:21, 21 April 2014 (UTC) [[:Air Transport Command]] → {{no redirect|Air Transport Command (disambiguation)}}; [[:Air Transport Command (World War II)]] → {{no redirect|Air Transport Command}} – [[WP:PRIMARYTOPIC]]. If we look at the other articles currently linked from [[Air Transport Command]] as a dab page, one is [[I Troop Carrier Command|a unit]] that only briefly used the name, (and - as it is also a WW2 unit - is technically ambiguous to the title this page is currently at), while the other is [[Canadian Forces Air Transport Command]] which is a longer full official/common title. [[User:The Bushranger|The Bushranger]] [[User talk:The Bushranger|One ping only]] 03:07, 11 April 2014 (UTC) : I have no objections. Whatever works is fine. [[User:Bwmoll3|Bwmoll3]] ([[User talk:Bwmoll3|talk]]) 09:39, 11 April 2014 (UTC) : '''Agree''' A hatnote on this article pointing to [[I Troop Carrier Command]] should be all that's needed to discriminate the articles. --[[User:Lineagegeek|Lineagegeek]] ([[User talk:Lineagegeek|talk]]) 21:58, 11 April 2014 (UTC) *'''Oppose''' – no good primarytopic case has been presented. [[User:Dicklyon|Dicklyon]] ([[User talk:Dicklyon|talk]]) 00:39, 12 April 2014 (UTC) **In what way has it not been presented? What other topics have a claim? A gBooks check for "Air Transport Command" shows only three results in the first '''9 pages''' of results that are ''not'' referring to this - and of those one a misnaming of the RAF Transport Command and the other is a translation of ''Groupement des Moyens Militaire de Transports Aeriens''. - [[User:The Bushranger|The Bushranger]] [[User talk:The Bushranger|One ping only]] 02:47, 12 April 2014 (UTC) Why was this page moved to '''Air Transport Command (USAF)'''???? The command was a part of the United States Air Force for only a brief time. It was a World War II command of the United States Army Air Forces for nearly five years. This was NOT what I concurred with during the move request. [[User:Bwmoll3|Bwmoll3]] ([[User talk:Bwmoll3|talk]]) 18:07, 13 April 2014 (UTC) : I do not see where the discussion to move this article was concluded. The USAF disambiguation was not part of the discussion; in fact the discussion was to remove the disambiguation alltogether [[User:Bwmoll3|Bwmoll3]] ([[User talk:Bwmoll3|talk]]) 18:22, 13 April 2014 (UTC) ::didn't see the discussion! Point taken about USAAF. Change it to Air Transport Command (US) or (USAAF)![[User:Petebutt|Petebutt]] ([[User talk:Petebutt|talk]]) 18:31, 13 April 2014 (UTC) ::: '''Oppose''' this suggestion. '''Support''' original suggestion. Parenthetical is not required for disambiguation. --[[User:Lineagegeek|Lineagegeek]] ([[User talk:Lineagegeek|talk]]) 20:24, 13 April 2014 (UTC) :::I've moved the page back to [[Air Transport Command (World War II)]], the title it was at when this discussion began. - [[User:The Bushranger|The Bushranger]] [[User talk:The Bushranger|One ping only]] 19:49, 13 April 2014 (UTC) :[[Air Transport Command (WWII)]], [[Air Transport Command (USA)]], [[Air Transport Command (U.S.)]], [[Air Transport Command (USAAF)]], [[Air Transport Command (USAAC)]] should probably redirect here, whatever title it uses. -- [[Special:Contributions/65.94.77.36|65.94.77.36]] ([[User talk:65.94.77.36|talk]]) 22:00, 14 April 2014 (UTC) ::No need to create multiple redirects as it appears this is the primary topic. [[User:GraemeLeggett|GraemeLeggett]] ([[User talk:GraemeLeggett|talk]]) 22:21, 14 April 2014 (UTC) *'''Oppose''' It is not clear that a casual mention of an "air transport command" would be "highly likely" and "much more likely" per [[wp:primarytopic]] to refer to the American than to the British or Canadian ones. Also, I'd consider "(US)" or "(USAAF)" a better disambiguator per [[WP:MILMOS#UNITS]]. [[Special:Contributions/Victor_falk|''walk'']] [[user:victor falk|''victor falk'']] [[user_talk:victor falk|''talk'']] 07:17, 16 April 2014 (UTC) **Please see the comment regarding the gBooks search above that establishes a clear [[WP:PRIMARYTOPIC]]. - [[User:The Bushranger|The Bushranger]] [[User talk:The Bushranger|One ping only]] 07:58, 16 April 2014 (UTC) ::The RAF unit never had the word "Air" in it. I found the relatively new [[European Air Transport Command]] organization so have added it to disambig. But don't think that dilutes Primary Topic argument (significantly). [[User:GraemeLeggett|GraemeLeggett]] ([[User talk:GraemeLeggett|talk]]) 11:28, 16 April 2014 (UTC) ::: [[European Air Transport Command]] needs disambiguation all by itself. [[United States Air Forces Europe]] had a subordinate EATS from 1945 to 1948 which at the time may have moved more cargo and people than any civil airline on the continent in its first years. And [[Air Transport Command (USAAC)]] -- where does that come from? ::: It seems to me that the only competition for [[Air Transport Command]] (as opposed to [[Air transport command]] is the Canadian command, which had the name (in caps) for a number of years, and that has been taken care of by [[WP:NCDAB]] 1. Natural Disambiguation. --[[User:Lineagegeek|Lineagegeek]] ([[User talk:Lineagegeek|talk]]) 21:39, 16 April 2014 (UTC) ::::: It is not NATURALDIS, the CF ATC is at ATC (CF), if you click on the disambiguation page link you'll end up with parenthetical disambiguation. -- [[Special:Contributions/65.94.77.36|65.94.77.36]] ([[User talk:65.94.77.36|talk]]) 05:47, 17 April 2014 (UTC) :::::::[[Air Transport Command (Canadian Armed Forces)]] only got moved to that title on the 13th. It ''was'' naturally disambiguated when this discussion started. [[User:GraemeLeggett|GraemeLeggett]] ([[User talk:GraemeLeggett|talk]]) 10:27, 17 April 2014 (UTC) ::::::::And I've just moved it back as controversial. The user who moved it has a history of making...''unconventional''...page moves but never ''quite'' to the point of anything being done about it. - [[User:The Bushranger|The Bushranger]] [[User talk:The Bushranger|One ping only]] 21:32, 17 April 2014 (UTC) *'''Support''' move to Air Transport Command as primary topic. [[User:MilborneOne|MilborneOne]] ([[User talk:MilborneOne|talk]]) 19:30, 19 April 2014 (UTC) *'''Support''' as proposed. It's clearly the [[WP:PRIMARYTOPIC|primary topic]]. [[User:Armbrust|Armbrust]] [[User talk:Armbrust|The Homunculus]] 00:21, 20 April 2014 (UTC) :''The above discussion is preserved as an archive of the proposal. '''Please do not modify it.''' Subsequent comments should be made in a new section on this talk page. No further edits should be made to this section.
